description.narrative: Youth unemployment in Uganda is the highest in Africa. A recent study ?Lost opportunity? Gaps in youth policy and programming in Uganda? by Action Aid, Uganda National NGO Forum and Development Research and Training put youth unemployment at 62%, although the African Development Bank says it could be as high as 83%. In refugee settlements the figures are the highest.Finn Church Aid (FCA) has been supporting Congolese refugees in Rwamwanja settlement since 2012. In 2014 an assessment was commissioned which n oted that the Congolese refugee youth in the Rwamwanja settlement and host community youth had no opportunities for post-primary education.The main objective of the project is: Improved standard of living of Congolese refugee and host community youth in Rw amwanja Refugee Settlement through access to marketable vocational skills.Expected results:Increased access to marketable Vocational skills among Congolese youth in Rwamwanja Refugee Settlement and the host community by 2017Increased access to employment o pportunities by the trained Congolese and host community youth through placement and apprenticeship by 2017Right-holders/ beneficiaries: Congolese youth and youth from the host communityDuty-bearers engaged in the project: Office of the Prime Minister (OPM ), The Directorate of Industrial Training in the Ministry of Education, The District Local GovernmentImplementing partner:Local implementing partner to be identified.The project is a joint pilot with Finnish private sector actors Fuzu (providing vocational + employment counsellor mobile application) and InnoOmnia (vocational training curriculum development).
